required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Storage Facility for Tissues Obtained From Patients With Malignant Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of the Tumor Microenvironment and Immune Response in Malignant Melanoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: This study collects and stores blood and tumor samples from patients with malignant melanoma and healthy individuals. The purpose of this study is to gain a better understanding of the causes of melanoma and how melanoma tumors behave. Storing blood and tumor samples for future research may lead to new discoveries that may ultimately help with diagnosing or treating this disease.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
I. Facilitate studies aimed at investigating new prognostic markers and potentially therapeutic therapies in malignant melanoma.
OUTLINE:
Patients undergo collection of blood samples at the time of the initial diagnostic work-up, and possibly prior to the initiation of surgery, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or radiation therapy, at tumor progression or recurrence, and annually during routine follow-up (no more than 4 blood draws per year). Patients may also undergo collection of tissue sample during standard of care surgical or radiologic procedures. Healthy individuals undergo collection of blood samples up to 4 times over 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: New prognostic markers in malignant melanoma
primary_outcome.description: Facilitate studies aimed at investigating new prognostic markers and potentially therapeutic therapies in malignant melanoma. . Draws conducted at baseline prior to immune therapy, four weeks after draw 1 and prior to the third cycle.

arm_group.description: Patients undergo collection of blood samples at the time of the initial diagnostic work-up, and possibly prior to the initiation of surgery, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or radiation therapy, at tumor progression or recurrence, and annually during routine follow-up (no more than 4 blood draws per year). Patients may also undergo collection of tissue sample during standard of care surgical or radiologic procedures. Healthy individuals undergo collection of blood samples up to 4 times over 1 year.

intervention.description: Undergo collection of blood and tissue samples

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are being evaluated or treated for malignant melanoma by members of the departments of Surgical Oncology, Medical Oncology, and Radiation Oncology and normal controls

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with malignant melanoma or personal history of melanoma
- Normal donors
- Informed consent can be obtained
- Patients with any stage of malignant melanoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incarcerated individuals will be excluded from this protocol

overall_official.affiliation: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

overall_contact.last_name: The Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

facility.name: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center
